Datasets

Source: R/datasets.R
alcohol.Rd

alcohol and chlamydiae datasets

alcohol

chlamydiae

Format

A list containing

X

the normalized OTU data,

Y

the alcohol intake phenotype,

tree

the corresponding phylogenetic tree,

taxonomy

the taxonomic lineages of the OTUs.

Source

Wu, Gary D., et al. "Linking long-term dietary patterns with gut microbial enterotypes." Science 334.6052 (2011): 105-108.

Caporaso, J. G., et al. (2011). "Global patterns of 16S rRNA diversity at a depth of millions of sequences per sample." PNAS, 108, 4516-4522. PMCID: PMC3063599

Details

The alcohol data set was taken from a study of the dietary association with the gut microbiome (Wu, 2011). Here we include the alcohol intake as the primary phenotype. The OTU abundance data consists of 98 samples with 949 OTUs with prevalence > 10 normalized to account for variable library sizes.

The chlamydia data set is taken from a 16s rRNA diversity study narrowed to the Chlamydiae bacteria taxon, originally appearing in PNAS.
